content.content: You should be sent home with a clear discharge plan that you and/or the patient understands.[^7][^123][^124] [Taking Charge of Your Healthcare Discharge Plan from CAPS](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Resources_Checklist_Hospital_Exit_Checklist.pdf "Taking Charge of Your Healthcare Discharge Plan from CAPS") [Transitioning Newborns From NICU to Home from AHRQ](https://www.ahrq.gov/sites/default/files/publications/files/nicupacket.pdf) [Medicare Hospital Discharge Checklist from CMS ](https://www.medicare.gov/pubs/pdf/11376-discharge-planning-checklist.pdf) [Taking Care of Myself: A Guide for When I Leave the Hospital from AHRQ ](https://www.ahrq.gov/patients-consumers/diagnosis-treatment/hospitals-clinics/goinghome/index.html) [Your Hospital Survival Guide from Consumer Reports ](https://www.consumerreports.org/cro/2012/10/your-hospital-survival-guide/index.htm) [Opioids After Surgery from ISMP Canada ](https://www.ismp-canada.org/download/OpioidStewardship/OpioidsAfterSurgery-EN.pdf) Embedded content: https://youtu.be/7A1lfiZLxBY ## Ask Questions!  The nurse will go over the discharge plan with you and your family or friend.[^7][^10] Questions to ask before the patient is discharged: 1\. If the patient has a bandage or dressing, when will it need to be changed?[^7][^123][^124] 2\. Who does the patient call for help?[^7][^123][^124] 3\. Repeat back or "teach back" medication, treatment &/or self-care instructions to your doctor & nurse.[^12] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/MWUM7LIXDeA [5 Questions to Ask About Your Medications from ISMP Canada](https://www.ismp-canada.org/download/MedRec/MedSafety_5_questions_to_ask_poster.pdf) [5 Moments for Medication Safety from the World Health Organization](https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/311157/WHO-HIS-SDS-2019.3-eng.pdf?ua=1 "5 Moments for Medication Safety from the World Health Organization") 4\. Can I use my phone to record your discharge instructions? 5\. Will the patient need stool softeners or bowel medications if they are going home with narcotic pain medications?[^7] [Opioids After Surgery from ISMP Canada](https://www.ismp-canada.org/download/OpioidStewardship/OpioidsAfterSurgery-EN.pdf) 6\. Does my primary care doctor know about my admission to the hospital?[^7][^123][^124] 7\. Will a nurse or physical therapist visit the patient at home from a home health agency?[^7][^123][^124] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/U2o9V8uBmQ4?list=PL96EE3EE3F1C6B859 8\. Can you or the patient read the prescription? 9\. Where does the patient get discharge medications?[^7][^123][^124] ![Hospital medications](http://www.rncentral.com/wp-content/uploads/5%20rights.jpg) 10\. Will the patient go home with medical equipment?[^7][^123][^124] ![walkers](https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hub/114266/file-16410688-png/images/c--documents_and_settings-ninar-desktop-walkers_and_assistive_devices_sm.png) 11\. Who will pay for this equipment?[^7] 12\. How much will the patient be responsible for the medical equipment?[^7] 13\. Are there any foods or drinks the patient can’t have when going home?[^7][^123][^124] ![Food display](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/1ye51j0qDKIOa0UUqSgi8G/3ea1170622c52d7741b7317e152bca48/Food_display.jpg) 14\. When can the patient shower or take a bath?[^7][^123][^124] ![Bathroom](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/2PSJo2UlnOGimIyc4kWKmo/376b2fd5c5a2b7ed71524c4412c07197/Bathroom.jpg) 15\. Will any of the new medications interfere with medications the patient was taking before coming to hospital?[^7] [Taking Medications-What to Ask Your Doctor from MedlinePlus ](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/patientinstructions/000535.htm) [Your Medicine: Be Smart. Be Safe from AHRQ ](https://www.ahrq.gov/patients-consumers/patient-involvement/ask-your-doctor/tips-and-tools/yourmedques.html) [Drug Reaction Information from MedlinePlus](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/drugreactions.html) [Mayo Clinic Drug & Supplement Information ](https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements) [Drugs, Herbs and Supplement Information from MedlinePlus](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/druginformation.html) [Medication Errors by MedlinePlus](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/medicationerrors.html) 16\. Will the patient’s medication insurance pay for the new medications?[^7] 17\. Will the new medications need to be reviewed by the insurance plan?[^7] 18\. How much physical activity can the patient do when home?[^7][^123] ![AdobeStock 123144794](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/7u98QTxf6hqTuUe6fqYz1S/ae93cc1c8da77bae9a3dcba1fd53d325/AdobeStock_123144794.jpeg) 19\. You should have your follow up appointments scheduled before you leave the hospital[^7][^123][^124] 20\. Plan to have family and/or friends help you once you are home.[^7] 21\. If you or your loved one is going to a skilled nursing home or rehabilitation facility, how long will they be there?[^7] [Skilled Nursing or Rehabilitation Facility Information from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/patientinstructions/000435.htm) 22\. Call the Physician if you or your loved one has any of the following: [^7][^24][^25][^26][^27][^28][^123][^124] - Shortness of breath, gasping, panting and/or fast breathing - Becomes very pale - Cold sweats, fever or chills - Confusion, dizziness, &/or acting strangely - Nausea and/or vomiting - Extreme pain - Headache not better after pain medication - Swelling of the face and hands - Sudden weight gain of 5 lbs in one week - Low urine or not having bowel movements - Oozing or pus from a wound or incision - Extra redness at wound or incision - Increased warmth at incision or wound - Seeing spots, flashing lights, blurring or unable to see from one eye or both - Yellowing of the skin - Bleeding from gums, nose, eyes or in urine &/or bowel movements - Seizures  [Your Discharge Planning Brochure from CMS](https://www.medicare.gov/sites/default/files/2018-07/11376-discharge-planning-checklist.pdf "Your Discharge Planning Brochure from CMS") [Making the World Safer for Senior Citizens by Senior Living](https://www.seniorliving.org/research/injury-prevention-guide/ "Making the World Safer for Senior Citizens by Senior Living") [Leaving the Hospital-Your Discharge Plan from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/patientinstructions/000867.htm) [^7]: Hallisey J.
